alert.note: Alert for Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 5:29PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Boyd, northwestern Lawrence, Carter and northwestern Wayne Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 528 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Durbin, or near Yatesville Lake State Park, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Grayson, Olive Hill, Wayne, Beech Fork State Park, Cannonsburg, Grayson Lake State Park, Carter Caves State Park, Kenova, Catlettsburg, Ceredo, Webbville, Princess, Coalton, Denton, Burnaugh, Rush, Durbin, Centerville and South Point. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 149 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
